document_data.name: Hissing Stones
document_data.mainbody:
The '''Hissing Stones''' bathhouse was an amenity and local landmark of [[Baldur's Gate]], being one of the oldest buildings in the city as of the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. The establishment had a sterling reputation as the city's safest and most confidential meeting area among the various Baldurian power groups.

It was owned and operated by [[Merilyn Allaryr]], a [[moon elf]] with enough experience and acumen to effectively manage the various personalities and political groups that patronized her establishment. She paid her staff well enough that they were largely insusceptible to bribery.
document_data.Description:
[[File:Seatower of bg.jpg|thumb|300px|''The location of the Hissing Stones in the [[Seatower]] neighborhood.'']]
The bathhouse featured a central cloister of cold lounging pools with steam rooms in the western wing and hot baths available in the eastern wing.

The bathhouse was decorated in the same architectural style as buildings from the [[Old Empires|Old Empire]] confederation of city-states of [[Chessenta]], with hypocaust flooring and walls decorated by beautiful mosaics made of tile.

Services.Prices:
Costs of the bathhouse as of [[1479 DR]]:
* 5 [[sp]] for a day at the bathhouse,
* 1 [[gp]] for a session with a "sinew soother", and
* 2 gp for a curative salt bath.
Services.Rules:
The owner and attendees of the Hissing Stones maintained a strict set of rules:
* Clients were not allowed to bear any [[weapon]]s within,
* Clients were only allowed to wear the house's own complementary [[silk]] robes, and
* No violence of any kind was permitted inside.
